intro: Hieracium illyricum subsp. prediliense, commonly known as the Illyrian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and morphological traits that set it apart from other members of the Hieracium genus.
